alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 3:52PM EDT until July 08 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Bucks and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Norristown, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Hatboro, Ambler, Chalfont, Plymouth Meeting, Willow Grove, Horsham, North Wales, and New Britain. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 332 and 340. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 19. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 26. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
